explains: adj. 未经证实的，无事实根据的

sentences.en: I do object to their claim, which I find totally unsubstantiated.
sentences.cn: 我确实反对他们的说法，我发现那是完全没有根据的。

sentences.en: There are reports that some military aircraft flew information when they were low on fuel during the Second World War, but Dr. Lissaman says they are unsubstantiated.
sentences.cn: 有报道称，二战期间，一些军机曾在燃料不足的情况下编队飞行。但利萨曼博士表示，这些说法没有根据。

sentences.en: Most negative comments, on both sides, are usually technically unsubstantiated.
sentences.cn: 所有的负面评论，无论哪一方，通常都是技术上站不住脚的。
